Class Unlocalized<T>

java.lang.Object
  net.derquinse.common.i18n.Unlocalized<T>
Type Parameters:
T - Localized value type.
All Implemented Interfaces:
Function<Locale,T>, Supplier<T>, Localized<T>
public final class Unlocalized<T>
extends Object
implements Localized<T>

Adapter for language-independent or unlocalized values.

Author:
Andres Rodriguez

public static <T> Unlocalized<T> of(T value)
Returns an unlocalized value.

Type Parameters:
T - Value type.
Parameters:
value - Value to adapt.
Returns:
The unlocalized value or null if the argument is null.

get

public T get()
Description copied from interface: Localized
Returns the default value for the localized object. The returned value must be non-null. Note that the default value may not be the value for the systems default locale.

Specified by:
get in interface Supplier<T>
Specified by:
get in interface Localized<T>
Returns:
The localized object's default value.

apply

public T apply(Locale locale)
Description copied from interface: Localized
Returns the object for the specified locale. If no value for the specified locale is found or the argument is null, the default value must be returned. The returned value must be non-null.

Specified by:
apply in interface Function<Locale,T>
Specified by:
apply in interface Localized<T>
Parameters:
locale - The requested locale.
Returns:
The localized object.
